sub_title: Climate Change Analyst @ Nexio Projects | Corporate Sustainability | Energy & Decarbonisation | Terra.do Fellow
summary:
Climate Change Analyst supporting companies worldwide on their sustainability journey from compliance to sustainable value creation.  I help 

👣 Calculate and track CO2 footprints for organizations and products.
📃Transparently disclosing environmental performance and climate commitments to initiatives and certification programs.
🛣️ Evaluate risks and opportunities, and formulate climate strategy.
🔎 Identify emissions hotspots and develop data-driven decarbonization strategies to reduce your company's carbon footprint.
📉 Set and communicate emissions reduction targets, ensuring continuous progress towards a low-carbon future.
🌲 Identify and obtain carbon offsets & energy certificates to abate residual emissions.

I specialize in working with diverse sectors, including manufacturing, chemicals, automotives, logistics, technology, retail, and more, while currently pursuing upskilling in energy and supply chain-related decarbonization.

Passionate about driving positive change and supporting organizations in their sustainability goals. Let's collaborate to make a meaningful impact on our planet. Connect with me to discuss how I can assist your sustainability journey. #ClimateAction #Sustainability #Decarbonization #NetZero

contributors.headline: Climate Change Analyst @ Nexio Projects | Corporate Sustainability | Energy & Decarbonisation | Terra.do Fellow

projects.title: Preserving the Peatlands - Water Quality
projects.description: A large part of the Netherlands between Amsterdam and Utrecht were peatlands, submerged and marshy, until anthropogenic activities of land drainage for agriculture and settlement brought thousands of years of carbonaceous peat to the surface.  This peat is now oxidizing and contributing to almost 4.25Mton of CO2 every year.  The answer cannot be to depopulate these regions and risk affecting the livelihoods of thousands, especially given the reliance of the Dutch dairy industry on these regions.  The answer lies in improving water quality and quantity, so as to provide and maintain the moisture that preserves the peat.  This design case employs Reflexive Interactive Design (RID) to identify requirements, assess them, identify key functions, create design scenarios from these functions, and finally to assess and grade these scenarios to find a solution that ultimately leads to an optimal scenario which is as close to the ideal score as possible.  Done under the aegis of Dr. Bert van't Ooster, Dr. Arni Jannsen, and Dr. Marjolein Derks, under the commission of Dr. Henk van Hardeveld, Team Leader at Waternet.

projects.title: Domestic Energy-Sufficiency in Vancouver, BC, Canada
projects.description: This case study project follows the use of various renewable technologies, such as photovoltaics , solar heat collectors, wind turbines, and home-fermented ethanol, along with energy storage solutions, to completely eliminate energy dependence of a hypothetical upscale household in Vancouver, BC, Canada, performed under the guidance of Dr. Annemiek ter Heijne, and supervised by Carlos Contreras Davila.

projects.title: Spirulina Protein in Refinery Operations (S.P.I.R.O)
projects.description: This project presents a complete biorefinery design, cost and profitability analysis on the multiproduct biorefinery of Arthrospira platensis (popularly known as Spirulina), beginning from algal cultivation, towards the extraction of proteins, lipids, and anti-cancer, anti-oxidant, anti-aging pigment Phycocyanin (with the main productivity being that of the proteins).  These proteins can compete with conventional protein supplements, or serve as standalone nutraceuticals to countries fighting malnourishment.  Algal oils thus obtained can be used in edible oils and in other chemical processes, while Phycocyanin can be used in cancer therapy, cosmetics, nutraceuticals, and food colouring too.  This was done under the guidance of Dr. Costas Nikiforidis, Dr. Antoinette Kazbar, and Giuseppe Olivieri.

proteins | lipids | soft matter

projects.title: RemediaATES: Combined remediation of volatile chlorinated hydrocarbons and thermal energy storage in Woerden, The Netherlands
projects.description: This project deals with bioremediation of soils and aquifers which have been contaminated through the solvation of underground pools of chlorinated volatile organic compounds (CVOCs), specifically chloroethenes, through bioaugmentation with species such as Dehaloccoides spp. and Geobacter spp., along with two-pronged biostimulation using lactate (also used for pre-treatment) and possibly butyrate.  This is done so as to remediate groundwater, which is essential for both drinking water and for usage in Aquifer Thermal Energy Storage (ATES).  This was done under the guidance and supervision of Dr. Tim Grotenhuis, and Dr. Jan Weijma.

profile_positions.description:
Helping companies in the EU, North America, Asia-Pacific, and South Asia on their climate journeys by supporting them in:

- Monitoring:  GHG inventory calculation & tool development (Scopes 1, 2 & 3 and Product carbon footprints) aligned to reporting standards such as the GHG Protocol, ISO 14064, ISO 14067, GLEC, WBCSD Pathfinder Framework, etc., to fulfil both voluntary disclosure and regulatory requirements.

- Reporting:  Expertise in reporting to initiatives such as GRI, CDP (Climate Change, Forests, Supply Chain), and other reporting programmes (Gigaton, Thesis).

- Strategy:  Conducting gap analyses, Value chain analyses, TCFD-aligned physical and transition Risk & Opportunity assessments, policy research, and creating data-driven Decarbonisation roadmaps.

- Decarbonisation:  Data-driven analytics to identify emissions hotspots and formulate reduction pathways and strategies by conducting feasibility studies driven by market insights.

- Target-setting:  Setting emissions reduction targets aligned with the Science-based Targets Initiative (SBTi) and calculating year-on-year reduction estimates.

Sectors I work with:
- Manufacturing
- Petrochemicals
- Specialty Chemicals
- Plastics
- Automotives
- Maritime
- Logistics
- Information Technology
- Food & Beverage
- Pharmaceuticals
- Consumer Goods
- Retail
- Packaging
- Printing
- Rentals

Pursuing upskilling in:
- Built-area certification (e.g. BREEAM)
- Energy mapping & modelling
- Decarbonisation implementation
profile_positions.title: Climate Change Analyst

profile_positions.description: Supporting the Climate Team at Nexio Projects with Carbon Footprint Analysis (CFA) for Scope 1&2, Scope 3 Screening, Climate Gap Analysis (CGA), and product Life Cycle Analysis (pLCAs) projects in Europe, North America and Asia-Pacific.
profile_positions.title: Climate Intern

profile_positions.description:
Supported the development of the Carbon Offsets and Nature-based Solutions part of Livabl's business by:

- Conducting in-depth market research on voluntary carbon trading markets to define a strategic niche for Livabl's Offsets division.
- Involving in business development by identifying leads and establishing partnerships with nature-based projects in India (both registered and unregistered), to create a robust network of environmental partners for clients of Livabl to collaborate with.
- Provided strategic guidance on the development of checkout-stage API integration for online marketplaces, enabling customers to offset their delivery emissions by purchasing credits from certified offset programs such as VCS and Gold Standard.
- Offered strategic inputs on the calculation methodology for the API, ensuring accurate and transparent carbon offset calculations.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager, Carbon Offsets and Nature-based Projects

profile_positions.description: Constructing business cases for sustainability. Conducting environmental impact valuation and carbon accounting. Creating content on sustainable transition strategy.
